title: New Market Research Report Jeans in Germany
text:
(MENAFN Press) Jeans in Germany registered moderate current value growth in 2014. In addition to the continuous trend towards more casual clothing styles in workplaces and for formal occasions rising demand for new styles of jeans with intricate designs made from high-quality materials created growth opportunities. In particular German women were intrigued by modern styles in line with the latest fashion trends and jeans that emphasise their individual feminine features. Positive growth was therefore registered in both value and volume terms in jeans in 2014.
Competitive Landscape
With an even wider selection of fashionable jeans lines than before H&M managed to increase its value share in jeans in 2014 taking the leading position in the category in the process. Its main competitor C&A saw a slight value sales decline in 2014 resulting in its value share dropping by one percentage point as the company finished the year with slightly lower value sales than H&M. Each of these companies enjoys a rather high level of consumer trust and loyalty while H&M has managed to improve consumer awareness of its brand and bolster its appeal to consumers. The use of large-scale advertising campaigns and celebrity brand ambassadors supported the overall success of the company during 2014 propelling it into the leading position in jeans.

Industry Prospects
Despite the growing levels of saturation in jeans in Germany the category is set to post positive value growth at constant 2014 prices over the forecast period. This positive development is likely to be mostly attributable to the ongoing future demand for well-designed jeans made from high-quality materials as companies seek to promote jeans a suitable attire for more formal functions and situations. Many men and women are expected to substitute their formalwear with more smart-casual attire although this will still need be to maintain a certain level of sophistication and adequate appeal. Thus the average unit price of jeans is expected to rise in constant 2014 terms over the forecast period contributing to the positive overall value growth expected in the category.
